title: Damien Duff reveals how close he came to joining Liverpool and Tottenham… and makes Chelsea fans very happy

There was a time when Damien Duff was one of the hottest properties in the Premier League. 
The pacy Irish winger was a regular name in the gossip columns in the early 2000s when he starred for Blackburn Rovers, with most of the big clubs interested in adding him to their ranks. 
Liverpool and Tottenham were two of those clubs most regularly linked, but when he did make the move from Ewood Park in 2003 it was to the newly cashed-up Chelsea to become one of Roman Abramovich's first signings. He'd have looked different in red (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
And in a new interview with Four Four Two magazine , Duff has lifted the lid on just how close he came to joining Liverpool, and how he never really wanted to join Spurs. 
"I came close [to Liverpool] two or three times," he said. "The first was a year or two before I signed for Chelsea. I would have gone there, but Blackburn wanted a big fee so not too many clubs could afford to buy me back then! When I was leaving Chelsea, the same move nearly happened again." Duff could have been playing with Xabi Alonso, not against him (Photo: Press Association) 
And then when Spurs came calling, it never really occurred to him to go. 
"I remember getting a message from (then Spurs boss) Martin Jol," he continued, "but I was a Chelsea fan after winning titles there so it was something I never really looked at." Beat them, then join them (Photo: Reuters) 
Duff won two Premier League titles and the League Cup under Jose Mourinho at Stamford Bridge, before moving on to Newcastle in 2006. 
That Liverpool move never happened for him though, and he clearly didn't want the Spurs one.
